tweet:
The facts are clear:

The White House launched a shadow foreign policy.

Critical military aid for #Ukraine was blocked.

It was done to pressure a foreign government to interfere in our 2020 elections.

This is what the Framers feared most. #ImpeachmentInquiry pic.twitter.com/yt1AXBJyby

The people of #HongKong should be the ones choosing their elected officials, NOT the CCP. China’s erosion of the “1 country-2 systems” framework must not go unchallenged.

I call on @senatemajldr to vote on the bipartisan #HKHRDA the House passed last month. https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1189032897778503680 …

My #PACTAct underscores the devastating consequences of Turkey’s invasion of northern Syria & Trump’s decision to let it happen. The House #ImpeachmentInquiry has collected extensive evidence and testimony, and soon the American people will hear from witnesses in an open setting. 

The resolution introduced today in the House Rules Committee will provide that pathway forward. https://twitter.com/HouseForeign/status/1189283616934760451 …

Even in times of great partisanship, we’re still working hard to get things done. 

Yesterday, the House unanimously passed my bipartisan bill to expand access to palliative and hospice care (#PCHETA) with 296 cosponsors. @AAHPM @ACSCAN @TheCHAUSA https://youtu.be/YSwUUUGfAGY

Thank you @ActionCorpsNYC for inviting me to join you and speak at last night’s community meal in the Bronx. 

Events like this that bring together people of different faiths, beliefs and backgrounds are so important and I was honored to attend. pic.twitter.com/QXU7A74OTF

I hope that my platform can help elevate Shai’s story. It’s one that needs to be heard. 

But even more to the point, I hope people like @senatemajldr and his @senategop colleagues start listening to Shai & the American people. 

It’s time to pass #HR8 and #HR1112.(7/7) pic.twitter.com/ClyaRaX7Mq

Why haven’t the thousands killed by guns been enough to take action? This shouldn’t be hard. Tougher background checks, stricter gun laws shouldn’t be hard. We banned assault weapons before and it saved lives. Why can’t we do it again?(6/7)

What Shai is doing is beyond commendable. It’s courageous. Her students are very lucky to have such a dedicated educator. I am very proud to represent such an extraordinary constituent. 

Still, it’s sad that is has come to something like this in the U.S.(5/7)

So, Shai made a choice. She’s making a choice, she says, for all the people whose choices have been taken away by #gunviolence. She has put her body on the line in hopes that in can spur change. Soon, she will switch to only water.(4/7)

Desperate times, Shai says, call for desperate measures. She knows there are those in Congress fighting for sensible gun safety laws. She knows groups like @momsdemand & @everytown are fighting every day to end the scourge of gun violence. But the #GOP blocks everything.(3/7)

Following the horrific shootings in #ElPaso and #Dayton, Shai had seen enough. She felt like she had to do something to counter the scourge of gun violence. So she began her hunger strike in September. On October 1st, she went to a fully liquid diet.(2/7)

This is Shai Stephenson. I met with Shai today in my #MountVernon office, on the first anniversary of the tragic #TreeOfLife shooting. 

Shai is a Bronx teacher, a Yonkers resident, and she is on a hunger strike to protest the #gunviolence epidemic.(1/7) pic.twitter.com/1RutcKDukI

I join with the millions of Hindus, Buddhists, Sikhs, and Jains to celebrate #Diwali, the Festival of Lights. It’s a time to join with family and friends and recommit ourselves to the triumph of light over darkness & knowledge over ignorance.
I had a great time seeing so many friends at tonight’s Muslim American Society of New York Annual Banquet in #NYC. pic.twitter.com/t60TdGxpuX

The House passed my bipartisan BURMA Act overwhelmingly twice: a bill to hold the military accountable & support further democratic consolidation in Burma so that this kind of horrific abuse doesn't occur again. It's time for @senatemajldr to hold a vote on this critical measure!

The Burmese military carried out a genocide against the Rohingya over two years ago, and all the warning signs are there that this could happen again. Tragically, the @StateDept response to these crimes has been tepid at best. https://www.usnews.com/news/us/articles/2019-10-22/un-mission-head-says-risk-of-genocide-recurring-in-myanmar …

While @HouseForeign keeps working to limit the damage Trump has done to our alliances and U.S. leadership on the world stage, we will stay focused on our joint inquiry into the Trump-Ukraine scandal.
From day one of his presidency, Trump has blatantly violated the emoluments clause of the Constitution. Now, he’s trying to drag our #G7 allies and partners into this mess.

Trump’s decision to use G-7 to enrich himself is outrageous. Once again, he is using U.S. foreign policy for personal gain, forcing our allies and partners to fill the rooms at one of his failing properties.

Mick Mulvaney now says there *was* a quid pro quo: Trading military aid for resurrecting a debunked 2016 conspiracy theory. Mulvaney says it was appropriate. He's wrong. Gandhi is a hero, not just to India, but to the world. “You may never know what results come of your actions, but if you do nothing, there will be no results.”  Happy #GandhiJayanti
His philosophy of truth, non-violence, and service has had an incredible impact and influence on the histories and futures of people and countries, including ours.
On the 150th anniversary of the birth of Mohandas Gandhi, I want to take a moment to recognize the many contributions Gandhi made to justice and peace around the world.  #GandhiJayanti
